LoversFemale.synopsis: One liner for the female half of the Lovers in the Park vignette.
LoversFemale.how_to_trigger: Talk to the female half of the Lovers in the LOW Park at ~ -105, 31, -37 in CTY_Main_A

BhaalAssassin03.synopsis: One liner for a Bhaal Cultist hiding in plain sight a tthe back of the Lower City Park
BhaalAssassin03.how_to_trigger: Speak to Cirian at the back of the Lower City by the pool, coords are -97, 29, -20 in CTY_Main_A

ReplacementFlamingFist04.synopsis: One liner for Replacement Flaming Fist 04
ReplacementFlamingFist04.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Flaming Fist guards on patrol in the Park after the Cultist ambush is resolved and the party has taken a long rest

MurderCongratulations.synopsis: Dialogthat plays after the cultits finish murdering civilians, if the players side with the Bhaal Cultists in the Lower City Park and help them murder some innocent civilians
MurderCongratulations.how_to_trigger: In recon: SetGlobalOsirisFlag SCE_Epilogue_State_HasStartedGo to the Park, when you have a dialog with the Cultists, choose to side with them. After murdering a few civilians, the combat should end and you will get this dialog.

EdenosaAnnoyed.synopsis: Edenosa gets annoyed if the players go to leave the park area. She then stops following them and resets her attitude to neutral.
EdenosaAnnoyed.how_to_trigger: Spot the Cultist ambush in the park, then talk to Edenosa about it so she follows you. Then instead of heading towards the ambush, try and leave the park.

BhaalAssassin04.synopsis: One-liner for a Bhaal Cultist hiding in plain sight in the Park. Dialog should only trigger if a player manages to sneak in to the ambush area. Combat will start after this dialog plays.
BhaalAssassin04.how_to_trigger: Go invisible and sneak in to the back of the Park and speak to the Hooded Figure there. Coords CTY_Main_A -98, 29, -19

PAD_SpottedAmbush.synopsis: The player spies figures lying in wait in a Lower City park.
PAD_SpottedAmbush.how_to_trigger: Succeed on the Perception check to notice the ambush in LOW_Park

ElderlyCouple02.synopsis: One-liner fallback and hasmet for elderly walker02 in the LOW Park
ElderlyCouple02.how_to_trigger: Speak to the elderly man who is walking in the LOW Park while he is separated from his partner

VampireBookClub01.synopsis: One-liner and HasMet for the vampire book club in the Park. As in they read vampire books. They aren't vampires. Probably.
VampireBookClub01.how_to_trigger: Speak to any of the three people in the book club in the CTY_Main_A Park at coords -92, 30, -50

FlamingFist1.synopsis: Dialog file for the Flaming Fist Guard 01 in the Lower City park. Bored dialog before the ambush, worried dialog after the ambush.
FlamingFist1.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Flaming Fist Guard 01 when they aren't in combat.

AD_MurderVictim.synopsis: AD while the Bhaal Sacrifice victim is running away/escapes escapes in the LOW Park situation.
AD_MurderVictim.how_to_trigger: Attack the Bhaal Cultist in the Park before they finish their sacrifice ritual. Cultist you need to attack is at -91, 27, -14 in CTY_Main_A

EdenosaSpottedAmbush.synopsis: Dialog to get Captain Edenosa to follow you in to the ambush with the Cultists
EdenosaSpottedAmbush.how_to_trigger: If you spotted the Cultist ambush but didn't trigger the fight yet, you can start this dialog to get the Flaming Fists to start following you.

AD_BoyWithDog.synopsis: A child in the Lower City Park is trying to get his dog to come back.
AD_BoyWithDog.how_to_trigger: Walk around in the Lower City Park in CTY_Main_A anywhere near coords: -121, 32, -41

ReplacementFlamingFist03.synopsis: One liner for Replacement Flaming Fist 03
ReplacementFlamingFist03.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Flaming Fist guards on patrol in the Park after the Cultist ambush is resolved and the party has taken a long rest

AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists.synopsis: AD between two Bhaal Cultists hiding in plain sight in the Lower City Park
AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists.how_to_trigger: Walk near the back of the Lower City Park near coords -110, 29, -21 in CTY_Main_A

PAD_FlowerDreadful.synopsis: Party banter when players arrive at certain place on the park, surrounded by flowers.
PAD_FlowerDreadful.how_to_trigger: Step into S_LOW_Park_FlowerPartyBanter_12177e60-d7b5-4ca1-896c-5d76db023aa5 with Astarion in the party.

GuardPreCombat.synopsis: Edenosa default dialog before Lower City Park Ambush, just a Flaming Fist guard standing around in the Park
GuardPreCombat.how_to_trigger: Talk to Edenosa before the Park Ambush occurs.

RetiredFists_Dwarf01.synopsis: Default dialog for the Retired Fists vignette in the LOW Park situation.
RetiredFists_Dwarf01.how_to_trigger: Talk to any of the Retired Fists in the lower city Park in BGO_Main_A

ChildLostBall02.synopsis: One-liner plus HasMet for one of the children who has lost their ball at the back of the Lower City Park.
ChildLostBall02.how_to_trigger: Talk to the child at the back of the Park in CTY_Main_A at coords: -93, 27, -28

AD_TryingLeavePark.synopsis: If Flaming Fist Captain Edenosa is following the player, she warns them not to leave the park area.
AD_TryingLeavePark.how_to_trigger: While Edenosa is following the player, try and leave the Park.

ReplacementFlamingFist01.synopsis: One liner for Replacement Flaming Fist 01
ReplacementFlamingFist01.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Flaming Fist guards on patrol in the Park after the Cultist ambush is resolved and the party has taken a long rest

AD_RetiredFists.synopsis: Some retired Flaming Fist in the Lower City Park sit around complaining about the youth of today and revisiting former glories. All are elves and dwarves, so they can remember the events of BG1 if we want to reference that
AD_RetiredFists.how_to_trigger: Wander around in the Park in CTY_Main_A near coords: -150, 30, -7

AD_CombatMaleCultists2.synopsis: Combat ADs for Male Bhaal Cultists
AD_CombatMaleCultists2.how_to_trigger: Get into combat with the Bhaal Cultists in the Lower City park

RetiredFists_Elf01.synopsis: Default dialog for RetiredFist_Elf01 in the Retired Fists vignette in the LOW Park situation.
RetiredFists_Elf01.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Elf Retired Fist in the lower city Park in BGO_Main_A at coords -150, 30, -5

AD_ArguingKids.synopsis: AD featuring two kids in the Park arguing about who should go collect their ball their threw in the fountain.
AD_ArguingKids.how_to_trigger: Go to the Park in Lower City and walk towards the waterfall in the back of the Park. Observe the kids near -94, 27, -27

ChildLostBall01.synopsis: One liner defeault dialog for the pair of kids who have lost their ball in the waterfall at the Park.
ChildLostBall01.how_to_trigger: Speak to either of the kids arguing about having lost their ball at the back of the Park in the Lower City.

AD_Lovers.synopsis: Two young lovers in the LOW Park have an AD talking about much and just enjoying each others company.
AD_Lovers.how_to_trigger: Walk around in the LOW Park at coords: -105, 31, -37

AD_CombatMaleCultists.synopsis: Combat ADs for Male Bhaal Cultists
AD_CombatMaleCultists.how_to_trigger: Get into combat with the Bhaal Cultists in the Lower City park

PAD_BloomridgePark.synopsis: When players, with Karlach in the party, arrive near a certain road in the park, players will hear this party banter.
PAD_BloomridgePark.how_to_trigger: Entering at S_LOW_Park_VB_FlowerPartyBanter_12177e60-d7b5-4ca1-896c-5d76db023aa5 with Karlach in the party.

FlamingFist2.synopsis: Dialog file for the Flaming Fist Guard 02  in the Lower City park. Bored dialog before the ambush, worried dialog after the ambush.
FlamingFist2.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Flaming Fist Guard 02 when they aren't in combat.

ReplacementFlamingFist02.synopsis: One liner for Replacement Flaming Fist 02
ReplacementFlamingFist02.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Flaming Fist guards on patrol in the Park after the Cultist ambush is resolved and the party has taken a long rest

AD_CombatFemaleCultists2.synopsis: Combat ADs for female Bhaal cultists in the LOW Park

LoversMale.synopsis: One liner for the Lovers in the Park.
LoversMale.how_to_trigger: Talk to either of the Lovers in the LOW Park at ~ -105, 31, -37

VampireBookClub03.synopsis: One-liner and HasMet for the vampire book club member03 in the Park. Its a vampire book club as in they read vampire books. They aren't vampires. Probably.
VampireBookClub03.how_to_trigger: Speak to one of the book club members in the CTY_Main_A Park at coords -92, 30, -50

ElderlyCouple01.synopsis: One-liner fallback and hasmet for elderly walker01 in the LOW Park
ElderlyCouple01.how_to_trigger: Speak to the elderly woman who is walking in the LOW Park while she is separated from her partner

AD_NosyKids.synopsis: After the players have the combat in the Park and long rest, some curious kids in the Park AD about the combat and look for anything cool.
AD_NosyKids.how_to_trigger: After the Park combat has resolved, take a long rest. Go near the fountain at the back of the Park to trigger the AD

RetiredFists_Dwarf02.synopsis: Default dialog for RetiredFist_Dwarf02 in the Retired Fists vignette in the LOW Park situation.
RetiredFists_Dwarf02.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Dwarf Retired Fist in the lower city Park in BGO_Main_A at coords -147, 30, -6

SWA_Rufie.synopsis: Very basic SWA dialog for Rufie, a dog in the Lower City Prk who just loves to run.
SWA_Rufie.how_to_trigger: In CTY_Main_A, go to the Park and try to talk to Rufie while he is running around near coords: -122, 31, -40

AD_CombatFemaleCultists.synopsis: Combat ADs for female Bhaal cultists in the LOW Park
AD_CombatFemaleCultists.how_to_trigger: Get into combat with the Bhaal Cultists in the Lower City Park

ElderlyCouple.synopsis: Simple dialog with an elderly couple out for a walk in the Lower City Park.
ElderlyCouple.how_to_trigger: Talk with the elderly couple out for a walk in the Lower City Park

BoyWithDog.synopsis: One-liner + HasMet for the Boy with Dog in the Lower City Park
BoyWithDog.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Boy in the Park in CTY_Main_A at about coords -122, 31, -41

VampireBookClub02.synopsis: One-liner and HasMet for the vampire book club member02 in the Park. Its a vampire book club as in they read vampire books. They aren't vampires. Probably.
VampireBookClub02.how_to_trigger: Speak to one of the book club members in the CTY_Main_A Park at coords -92, 30, -50

RetiredFists_Elf02.synopsis: Default dialog for RetiredFist_Elf02 in the Retired Fists vignette in the LOW Park situation.
RetiredFists_Elf02.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Elf Retired Fist in the lower city Park in BGO_Main_A at coords -151, 30, -10

AD_BookClub.synopsis: AD featuring 3 book club members ranting about a new vampire romance novel they all just finished.
AD_BookClub.how_to_trigger: Go near them in the LOW Park at coords around -91, 30, -52

LoversFemale_0.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
LoversFemale_0.text: You know, this park used to be a lovely spot for some peace and quiet. Alone. I suppose everything changes, eventually...

LoversFemale_1.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
LoversFemale_1.text: I'm sorry for Wendel, he does get a touch, ah, over-effusive about our courtship. Pay him no heed.

LoversFemale_2.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
LoversFemale_2.text: Gods, I thought at least this park would be safe. I suppose nowhere is, these days. Not really.

BhaalAssassin03_0.speaker: Cirian
BhaalAssassin03_0.text: People drop stacks of coins in that fountain... If you nick some, I won't tell!
BhaalAssassin03_0.context: NodeContext: italicised lines are whispered consipiratiroially

BhaalAssassin03_1.speaker: Cirian
BhaalAssassin03_1.text: Greetings, stranger. Say, have you visited the wishing fountain? Lovely place.

ReplacementFlamingFist04_0.speaker: Fist Moss
ReplacementFlamingFist04_0.text: I said, and I say again - back! You won't fool me.

ReplacementFlamingFist04_1.speaker: Fist Moss
ReplacementFlamingFist04_1.text: Step back! You can't be trusted - anyone here could be a cultist. Back, I say!

MurderCongratulations_2.speaker: Night Blade Vinnia
MurderCongratulations_2.text: You butcher well, favoured one. I see why Lady Orin chose you for Bhaal's service.

MurderCongratulations_0.speaker: Night Blade Vinnia
MurderCongratulations_0.text: But our Lord's thirst is not so easily slaked.

EdenosaAnnoyed_0.speaker: Manip Edenosa
EdenosaAnnoyed_0.text: Nothing. Waste my time again, and you'll find yourself acquainted with some shackles - got it?
EdenosaAnnoyed_0.context: NodeContext: Annoyed. Believes the player cried wolf about an ambush lying in wait.

BhaalAssassin04_0.speaker: Sinister Hooded Man
BhaalAssassin04_0.text: Got you right where we want you. FOR OUR LORD BHAAL!

BhaalAssassin04_1.speaker: Sinister Hooded Man
BhaalAssassin04_1.text: Lady Orin preserves you for our Lord Bhaal's service. Serve him well.

PAD_SpottedAmbush_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SpottedAmbush_0.text: There's figures hiding in the foliage - might be a trap.

ElderlyCouple02_0.speaker: Bertram Kostaka
ElderlyCouple02_0.text: Too busy to chat, I'm afraid. This walk must be completed.

ElderlyCouple02_1.speaker: Bertram Kostaka
ElderlyCouple02_1.text: If you spent as much time walking as you did talking, my friend, you'd have a body like mine in a decade or two!

VampireBookClub01_0.speaker: Kepli
VampireBookClub01_0.text: Sorry, would you mind leaving me be? These books won't discuss themselves.

VampireBookClub01_1.speaker: Kepli
VampireBookClub01_1.text: Oh, hello there! Feel free to listen in, but only members may participate in discussion.

VampireBookClub01_2.speaker: Kepli
VampireBookClub01_2.text: I think next time we'll hold our meeting inside.

FlamingFist1_0.speaker: Fist Bella
FlamingFist1_0.text: On your way - I can hardly keep watch if I'm talking to you, can I?

FlamingFist1_1.speaker: Fist Bella
FlamingFist1_1.text: The captain's the one in charge; take your woes to her.

FlamingFist1_2.speaker: Fist Bella
FlamingFist1_2.text: Bloody hells, who were that lot? And the captain - she's dead!

EdenosaSpottedAmbush_2.speaker: Manip Edenosa
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_2.text: What's the matter? Someone else sitting under your favourite tree?

EdenosaSpottedAmbush_5.speaker: Narrator
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_5.text: *You feel an all-too-familiar squirm in the recesses of your mind. She has a tadpole.*
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld/tadpole recognition FXInternalNodeContext: This node only if the player did not already have a moment of tadpole recognition with Cracklewall

EdenosaSpottedAmbush_8.speaker: Manip Edenosa
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_8.text: Got to keep up appearances, you understand - until the time's right. Praise the Absolute.
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Knowing look/Mindmeld FXInternalNodeContext: This node only if the player did not already have a moment of tadpole recognition with CracklewallNodeContext: Conspiratorial

EdenosaSpottedAmbush_7.speaker: Manip Edenosa
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_7.text: You been struck mute? Come on, out with it.

EdenosaSpottedAmbush_0.speaker: Player
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_0.text: There's some suspicious characters lurking deeper in the park. Might be armed.

EdenosaSpottedAmbush_10.speaker: Manip Edenosa
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_10.text: You gone soft in the head? I warned you against interfering in the Absolute's plans.
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_10.context: NodeContext: An incredulous hiss. Believes the player to be a coconspirator who can't follow basic instructions

EdenosaSpottedAmbush_3.speaker: Manip Edenosa
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_3.text: Walk away, while you still can. Nobody's indispensible.

EdenosaSpottedAmbush_6.speaker: Manip Edenosa
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_6.text: Is that so? Well they'll regret picking my shift to turn up. Show 'em to me.

EdenosaSpottedAmbush_4.speaker: Manip Edenosa
EdenosaSpottedAmbush_4.text: Something the matter? You look like a dog who's had its bone stolen.

AD_BoyWithDog_1.speaker: Albert
AD_BoyWithDog_1.text: Sparky! Spaaarkyyy! Come back! Heel, boy!

AD_BoyWithDog_4.speaker: Albert
AD_BoyWithDog_4.text: Come on Sparky, you've done so much running already today!

AD_BoyWithDog_5.speaker: Albert
AD_BoyWithDog_5.text: I want to go hooooome. Sparky!

AD_BoyWithDog_2.speaker: Albert
AD_BoyWithDog_2.text: We can come back and play tomorrow!

AD_BoyWithDog_3.speaker: Albert
AD_BoyWithDog_3.text: Mam's going to be steamin' if we don't get home by second lunch.

ReplacementFlamingFist03_0.speaker: Fist Ulinn
ReplacementFlamingFist03_0.text: Now, it'll definitely put off cultist attacks - but Steel Watchers? In this park? Bleedin' eyesore.

ReplacementFlamingFist03_1.speaker: Fist Ulinn
ReplacementFlamingFist03_1.text: As you were. Well, nearly as you were. Give the Steel Watcher a wide berth.

AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_2.speaker: Sinister Hooded Man
AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_2.text: Y - you said to hide my identity.

AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_8.speaker: Cirian
AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_8.text: And you took that to mean... this? With the robes? Shite-for-brains.

AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_5.speaker: Cirian
AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_5.text: I'm not talking to someone dressed in their bathrobe. I refuse.

AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_11.speaker: Sinister Hooded Man
AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_11.text: I don't see what your problem is with the robe. It hides my identity!

AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_4.speaker: Cirian
AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_4.text: But it's not exactly inconspicuous, is it? I just...

AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_9.speaker: Cirian
AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_9.text: I cannot believe you've come dressed like the villain in a tragicomedy.

AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_1.speaker: Sinister Hooded Man
AD_DisguisedBhaalCultists_1.text: Well, if you can't believe it - that makes it unexpected! Which is good, right?

PAD_FlowerDreadful_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FlowerDreadful_0.text: Flowers are so overrated. They're bright, gaudy, and almost never make good poisons.

PAD_FlowerDreadful_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FlowerDreadful_1.text: I agree with you, Astarion. We should torch this little patch of colour - it is an affront to the city's grim ambience.

PAD_FlowerDreadful_3.speaker: Player
PAD_FlowerDreadful_3.text: I used to be the scourge of the hells. Now flowers can make me cry.

PAD_FlowerDreadful_2.speaker: Player
PAD_FlowerDreadful_2.text: Each to their own, I suppose... Although I am right.

GuardPreCombat_14.speaker: Manip Edenosa
GuardPreCombat_14.text: No reason for you to linger unless you're after mischief - on your way.

GuardPreCombat_17.speaker: Manip Edenosa
GuardPreCombat_17.text: Be smart - find someone else to bother.

GuardPreCombat_18.speaker: Manip Edenosa
GuardPreCombat_18.text: Park's no place for a stroll anymore - more like to find a mugging than a picnic these days.
GuardPreCombat_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glances over the player, weighing them upNodeContext: Gruff

GuardPreCombat_1.speaker: Manip Edenosa
GuardPreCombat_1.text: Not so loud. You and I might have an understanding, but that doesn't go for everyone. Plenty of my comrades still serve the old order.

GuardPreCombat_6.speaker: Manip Edenosa
GuardPreCombat_6.text: Now hop along. When the time's right, the Absolute will tell us to act. Until then, we've got to play it natural. In her name.

GuardPreCombat_16.speaker: Player
GuardPreCombat_16.text: What's going on in the park?

GuardPreCombat_11.speaker: Manip Edenosa
GuardPreCombat_11.text: Nothing's going on. And even if there was something, you'd be wise to ignore it.

GuardPreCombat_19.speaker: Manip Edenosa
GuardPreCombat_19.text: Absolute's business. Got it? Now be off. You'll attract attention. In Her name.

GuardPreCombat_4.speaker: Narrator
GuardPreCombat_4.text: *You feel an all-too-familiar squirm in the recesses of your mind. She has a tadpole.*

GuardPreCombat_10.speaker: Manip Edenosa
GuardPreCombat_10.text: Or perhaps you'll find something bloodier. The Absolute's warriors are at work, just beyond here. You'd be wise to not interfere, kin.
GuardPreCombat_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld FX/no lipsyncNodeContext: Reassuring/conspiratorial

RetiredFists_Dwarf01_0.speaker: Vistra
RetiredFists_Dwarf01_0.text: In the old days those troublemakers would never have got so close to civvies.

RetiredFists_Dwarf01_1.speaker: Vistra
RetiredFists_Dwarf01_1.text: I tell you - it was all different back in the day. Being a Fist meant something.

RetiredFists_Dwarf01_2.speaker: Vistra
RetiredFists_Dwarf01_2.text: Fist these days cannae take a piss without a Steel Watcher helpin' them aim. It's pathetic.

ChildLostBall02_0.speaker: Conall
ChildLostBall02_0.text: I don't care what Emen said, I'm not getting the ball. And you can't make me.

ChildLostBall02_1.speaker: Conall
ChildLostBall02_1.text: Still not going to get Emen's ball. Bet it's real damp by now.

AD_TryingLeavePark_0.speaker: Manip Edenosa
AD_TryingLeavePark_0.text: Hold it! If you're so sure trouble's afoot, show me before you go wandering off.

ReplacementFlamingFist01_0.speaker: Fist Brottor
ReplacementFlamingFist01_0.text: I'd move along if I was you, citizen. Patrols have doubled since the... ah, recent troubles, so to speak.

ReplacementFlamingFist01_1.speaker: Fist Brottor
ReplacementFlamingFist01_1.text: Don't distract me, citizen. This park needs my keen eye.

AD_RetiredFists_1.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_1.text: So, Vistra. You reckon we'd still be better Fists than the current cohort?

AD_RetiredFists_4.speaker: Vistra
AD_RetiredFists_4.text: Peace of piss, mate. Easy. Yes.

AD_RetiredFists_12.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_12.text: Great. So let's get you out of that chair and into your chain mail, then? Show the young lot how it's done?

AD_RetiredFists_34.speaker: Thokki
AD_RetiredFists_34.text: My armour's not fit for years.

AD_RetiredFists_25.speaker: Avourel
AD_RetiredFists_25.text: Yeah, to be honest? Thought of holding a pike makes my back ache.

AD_RetiredFists_16.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_16.text: It's a young man's game. Right, Vistra?

AD_RetiredFists_9.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_9.text: Not seen action like that in a while.

AD_RetiredFists_5.speaker: Vistra
AD_RetiredFists_5.text: Those cultists are lucky they were on the other side of the park. Lucky.

AD_RetiredFists_31.speaker: Avourel
AD_RetiredFists_31.text: You'd have taken them, would you, Vistra?

AD_RetiredFists_6.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_6.text: Bollocks. These days we'd sooner throw our backs than a proper punch.

AD_RetiredFists_15.speaker: Thokki
AD_RetiredFists_15.text: Well, I, for one, count my lucky stars it happened elsewhere.

AD_RetiredFists_10.speaker: Avourel
AD_RetiredFists_10.text: Same here. My knees are buggered already, never mind running after cultists.

AD_RetiredFists_14.speaker: Vistra
AD_RetiredFists_14.text: You make a good point, Eldaernth.

AD_RetiredFists_3.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_3.text: You've known me long enough, Vistra. When haven't I?

AD_RetiredFists_33.speaker: Vistra
AD_RetiredFists_33.text: We could've used the Steel Watch back in the day. But that's because we fought actual threats.

AD_RetiredFists_19.speaker: Vistra
AD_RetiredFists_19.text: Back when the Fists were real Fists. Not bloody...

AD_RetiredFists_20.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_20.text: You're remembering the past pretty fondly, Vistra. Bit too fondly.

AD_RetiredFists_21.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_21.text: You telling me you'd have refused the Steel Watch's help on Returning Day a decade ago?

AD_RetiredFists_29.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_29.text: Big horrible beast? Slaughtered Duke Adrian? We could do bugger all about it?

AD_RetiredFists_11.speaker: Thokki
AD_RetiredFists_11.text: Lost a lot of good men that day.

AD_RetiredFists_22.speaker: Vistra
AD_RetiredFists_22.text: Look, all I'm saying is they've got it easier these days.

AD_RetiredFists_24.speaker: Thokki
AD_RetiredFists_24.text: Yeah, we didn't have these big metal bastards running the streets back in my day.

AD_RetiredFists_8.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_8.text: Thanks to the bloody Iron Crisis we barely had any metal back then.

AD_RetiredFists_18.speaker: Vistra
AD_RetiredFists_18.text: You're right, you're right. We Fists had to proper fight back then.

AD_RetiredFists_7.speaker: Vistra
AD_RetiredFists_7.text: We knew how to watch each other's backs.

AD_RetiredFists_28.speaker: Vistra
AD_RetiredFists_28.text: 'Absolute' this... 'end of the word' that... These young folk've no idea how good they've got it.

AD_RetiredFists_2.speaker: Eldaernth
AD_RetiredFists_2.text: Come off it, Vistra. You've been doing this same rant for years.

AD_RetiredFists_26.speaker: Avourel
AD_RetiredFists_26.text: Yeah, the first lot of young folk you said it about are old folk now!

AD_RetiredFists_27.speaker: Vistra
AD_RetiredFists_27.text: Piss off, the lot of youse.

AD_CombatMaleCultists2_0.speaker: Sinister Hooded Man, Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde, Death's Head of Bhaal Spaulder
AD_CombatMaleCultists2_0.text: You will bloody our hands, He will make us whole.

RetiredFists_Elf01_0.speaker: Eldaernth
RetiredFists_Elf01_0.text: Damn shame to see all this violence. I'd hoped that was all behind me.

RetiredFists_Elf01_1.speaker: Eldaernth
RetiredFists_Elf01_1.text: Don't listen to Vistra. She talks big for a short, old dwarf - those 'good ol' days' weren't all rosy.

RetiredFists_Elf01_2.speaker: Eldaernth
RetiredFists_Elf01_2.text: I reckon the current cohorts doing the best they can, given... y'know. Circumstances.

AD_ArguingKids_4.speaker: Conall
AD_ArguingKids_4.text: I thought it was our ball.

AD_ArguingKids_8.speaker: Emen
AD_ArguingKids_8.text: No, it was a present for me, so it's my ball! And you lost it.

AD_ArguingKids_14.speaker: Emen
AD_ArguingKids_14.text: Prove what? The ball's right there.

AD_ArguingKids_3.speaker: Emen
AD_ArguingKids_3.text: Pleaaaaasssse go and get our ball, Conall. I want to play.

AD_ArguingKids_0.speaker: Conall
AD_ArguingKids_0.text: I thought it was your ball. Get it yourself.

AD_ArguingKids_11.speaker: Conall
AD_ArguingKids_11.text: I'm not fetching it. Don't want to get wet.

AD_ArguingKids_7.speaker: Emen
AD_ArguingKids_7.text: Well then we're not friends anymore. I'm not talking to you until you get it back.

AD_ArguingKids_12.speaker: Conall
AD_ArguingKids_12.text: Not if I stop talking to you first!

AD_ArguingKids_10.speaker: Conall
AD_ArguingKids_10.text: Where did you say the ball was?

AD_ArguingKids_1.speaker: Conall
AD_ArguingKids_1.text: Ahh, but if you can see it, that means I can't have lost it, right?

AD_ArguingKids_13.speaker: Emen
AD_ArguingKids_13.text: Don't be mean, Conall, you know I don't like brain-riddles.

ChildLostBall01_0.speaker: Emen
ChildLostBall01_0.text: Stupid Conall, throwing my ba - Sorry. Mam said I shouldn't talk to strangers.

ChildLostBall01_1.speaker: Emen
ChildLostBall01_1.text: Stupid Conall. Ruining my ball. Turdbrain.

AD_Lovers_3.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_3.text: I still remember our first date in this park, you know. There were certainly less Fists about.

AD_Lovers_7.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
AD_Lovers_7.text: It's only been a month, Wendel. Of course you remember our first date.

AD_Lovers_16.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_16.text: But what a perfect month it's been - right, darling?

AD_Lovers_15.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_15.text: You know, I really don't think I've ever felt this way about someone before.

AD_Lovers_1.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
AD_Lovers_1.text: I remind you again, Wendel. One. Month.

AD_Lovers_6.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_6.text: You said you wanted to chat, my love?

AD_Lovers_19.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
AD_Lovers_19.text: Yes... I did want to chat, Wendel.

AD_Lovers_17.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_17.text: What did you want to talk about, my darling?

AD_Lovers_13.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
AD_Lovers_13.text: Well... I asked you here because... Gods. Never mind.

AD_Lovers_18.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_18.text: I just think this park is so beautiful, don't you, darling?

AD_Lovers_11.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
AD_Lovers_11.text: It's a bit loud, what with all these clanking guards.

AD_Lovers_10.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_10.text: I could ask them to keep it down. Anything for you, dear.

AD_Lovers_9.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
AD_Lovers_9.text: Listen, Wendel, I really think we need to have a chat.

AD_Lovers_14.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_14.text: Are we not already having a chat, my angel?

AD_Lovers_20.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_20.text: Come now, you know you can tell me anything.

AD_Lovers_4.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
AD_Lovers_4.text: I just don't know how to say it...

AD_Lovers_2.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
AD_Lovers_2.text: I think we should start seeing other people. There.

AD_Lovers_0.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_0.text: Well, there's plenty of folk in this park we could get to know!

AD_Lovers_5.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
AD_Lovers_5.text: Especially with all these new Fists. They'd be great craic, I bet.

AD_Lovers_12.speaker: Eugenie Kenridge
AD_Lovers_12.text: You are impossible sometimes, Wendel. Impossible.

AD_CombatMaleCultists_0.speaker: Sinister Hooded Man, Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde, Death's Head of Bhaal Spaulder
AD_CombatMaleCultists_0.text: Let this murder be his sacrament!

PAD_BloomridgePark_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BloomridgePark_0.text: | Looks nice, but there's some dark undercurrent here I can't quite put my finger on. |

PAD_BloomridgePark_2.speaker: Player
PAD_BloomridgePark_2.text: | Sure is nice, but is nicer to kill de bad guys. They're waiting for us! |

FlamingFist2_0.speaker: Fist Pard
FlamingFist2_0.text: Just my luck to get assigned to Captain Cracklewall. Mad as piss, that one.

FlamingFist2_1.speaker: Fist Pard
FlamingFist2_1.text: I wasn't even supposed to be on duty today - had plans to go fishing.

FlamingFist2_2.speaker: Fist Pard
FlamingFist2_2.text: Who were that lot?! Need to report this - need to get reinforcements!

ReplacementFlamingFist02_0.speaker: Fist Elda
ReplacementFlamingFist02_0.text: Double the guard - half the visitors. Folk won't fancy a wander round with us here.

ReplacementFlamingFist02_1.speaker: Fist Elda
ReplacementFlamingFist02_1.text: Word to the wise - keep your peepers sharp. If the cultists hid here, could be bloody anywhere.

AD_CombatFemaleCultists2_0.speaker: Cirian, Night Blade Vinnia, Night Blade Klarv

LoversMale_0.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
LoversMale_0.text: I do hope the Fist take a step back from the park soon, then it'd be the perfect spot for me and my Eugenie.

LoversMale_1.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
LoversMale_1.text: Right here, just one month ago, my Eugenie agreed to our courtship. It's a good place for romance, take it from me!

LoversMale_3.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
LoversMale_3.text: Though I must admit - all the clankery from the Flaming Fists dampens the mood somewhat.

LoversMale_2.speaker: Wendel Ashgrove
LoversMale_2.text: I can't believe it... I do hope all that horribleness doesn't tar the memory of this place. It's usually so lovely.

VampireBookClub03_0.speaker: Morgan
VampireBookClub03_0.text: Oh do leave me be, we're about to get to the good bit of the discussion!

VampireBookClub03_1.speaker: Morgan
VampireBookClub03_1.text: Hang on, hang on, don't distract me! I've been waiting a bloody month to talk about this book.

VampireBookClub03_2.speaker: Morgan
VampireBookClub03_2.text: You killed them - those people! In the robes! How thrilling...

ElderlyCouple01_0.speaker: Martina Kostaka
ElderlyCouple01_0.text: If you happen to see my husband, do trip him up for me. Every day we do this bloody walk, and every day he wanders off.

ElderlyCouple01_1.speaker: Martina Kostaka
ElderlyCouple01_1.text: Bloody Bertram... How does he walk so godsdamned fast...

AD_NosyKids_8.speaker: Tam
AD_NosyKids_8.text: Come on Cyrella. Tell us! How'd you know there was a fight here?

AD_NosyKids_16.speaker: Cyrella
AD_NosyKids_16.text: Fine. My big brother was here when it happened.

AD_NosyKids_3.speaker: Cyrella
AD_NosyKids_3.text: Oh yeah. He killed all the bad guys on his own.

AD_NosyKids_7.speaker: Cyrella
AD_NosyKids_7.text: Shut up, Skip! You're just jealous 'cos you don't have a big brother!

AD_NosyKids_9.speaker: Skip
AD_NosyKids_9.text: I do have a big brother!

AD_NosyKids_12.speaker: Cyrella
AD_NosyKids_12.text: Yeah but he's not cool. Or strong. My brother says yours is a loser.

AD_NosyKids_14.speaker: Cyrella
AD_NosyKids_14.text: This is it! This is the park!

AD_NosyKids_1.speaker: Tam
AD_NosyKids_1.text: Where all the fightin' happened? Really?

AD_NosyKids_2.speaker: Skip
AD_NosyKids_2.text: M-maybe we shouldn't walk around here.

AD_NosyKids_6.speaker: Cyrella
AD_NosyKids_6.text: Waaaah! Waaaah! I'm Skip, and I'm a little baaaabyyyyy.

AD_NosyKids_18.speaker: Tam
AD_NosyKids_18.text: This place is so cool, Cyrella. I think I saw a whole eyeball.

AD_NosyKids_13.speaker: Tam
AD_NosyKids_13.text: How did you find out about this place, Cyrella?

RetiredFists_Dwarf02_0.speaker: Thokki
RetiredFists_Dwarf02_0.text: Tell you what, city's gone down the gutter recently. All these attacks... It's no good.

RetiredFists_Dwarf02_1.speaker: Thokki
RetiredFists_Dwarf02_1.text: Sorry, pal. Table here's reserved for retired Fists only. Veteran perk, you understand.

RetiredFists_Dwarf02_2.speaker: Thokki
RetiredFists_Dwarf02_2.text: Say - you've a bit about you, though. Maybe you should think about enlisting.

SWA_Rufie_6.speaker: Narrator
SWA_Rufie_6.text: *The dog continues to run without a care in the world.*

SWA_Rufie_19.speaker: Sparky
SWA_Rufie_19.context: NodeContext: this is the happiest dog to ever dog

SWA_Rufie_11.speaker: Player
SWA_Rufie_11.text: Why are you running around in circles?

SWA_Rufie_27.speaker: Sparky
SWA_Rufie_27.context: NodeContext: super, SUPER pleased about it

SWA_Rufie_9.speaker: Player
SWA_Rufie_9.text: Your owner's calling for you. You should probably stop running.

SWA_Rufie_26.speaker: Sparky
SWA_Rufie_26.text: Stop... running? But - but then I won't be running anymore.

SWA_Rufie_34.speaker: Sparky
SWA_Rufie_34.text: What? Yeah it is! Love a run, me.

SWA_Rufie_32.speaker: Player
SWA_Rufie_32.text: Be careful - I heard dogs can only run one hundred times in their lives.

SWA_Rufie_35.speaker: Sparky
SWA_Rufie_35.text: WHAT? Runs can... run out? Oh no...

SWA_Rufie_0.speaker: Player
SWA_Rufie_0.text: Running will feel even better tomorrow if you take a little break for the day.

SWA_Rufie_22.speaker: Sparky
SWA_Rufie_22.text: Run? Did you say run? GREAT IDEA! Runrunrunrunrun...

SWA_Rufie_23.speaker: Sparky
SWA_Rufie_23.context: NodeContext: he's REALLY thinking about it, this is the most thought this dog has ever had to contend with in his life

SWA_Rufie_10.speaker: Player
SWA_Rufie_10.text: Try to calm the overexcitable hound.

SWA_Rufie_12.speaker: Narrator
SWA_Rufie_12.text: *The dog's excited fervour wanes at your beckoning. It looks around for its master, ready to leave.*

SWA_Rufie_17.speaker: Player
SWA_Rufie_17.text: Hum a calming lullaby to soothe the manic dog.

AD_CombatFemaleCultists_0.speaker: Cirian, Night Blade Vinnia, Night Blade Klarv

ElderlyCouple_0.speaker: Martina Kostaka
ElderlyCouple_0.text: Oh, don't look so dour, Bertram. You can do two walks tomorrow to make up for it.

ElderlyCouple_1.speaker: Bertram Kostaka
ElderlyCouple_1.text: No time to chat - we've a walk to finish! Forty-three years and I've never stopped short.

ElderlyCouple_8.speaker: Martina Kostaka
ElderlyCouple_8.text: Yes, and my knees feel every year.

ElderlyCouple_6.speaker: Martina Kostaka
ElderlyCouple_6.text: Oho - a new face in the park! How charming.

ElderlyCouple_2.speaker: Bertram Kostaka
ElderlyCouple_2.text: First you worry about the guards, now you're chatting to every stranger we see - there's no time Martina! We must complete our walk!

ElderlyCouple_4.speaker: Martina Kostaka
ElderlyCouple_4.text: Fine, darling. Fine. I apologise for my husband, he takes his 'daily constitutional' very seriously.

ElderlyCouple_7.speaker: Martina Kostaka
ElderlyCouple_7.text: Good heavens - I think that's quite enough walking for today, Bertram.

ElderlyCouple_5.speaker: Bertram Kostaka
ElderlyCouple_5.text: But... I've not missed my walk in forty three -

BoyWithDog_3.speaker: Albert
BoyWithDog_3.text: Sparky, Spaaaarkyyy! We need to go home for tea!

BoyWithDog_10.speaker: Albert
BoyWithDog_10.text: Ugh. He won't listen, and he's too fast to catch. Stupid dog.

BoyWithDog_1.speaker: Player
BoyWithDog_1.text: That's quitter talk. Go get your dog.

BoyWithDog_7.speaker: Albert
BoyWithDog_7.text: I tried already - but I've only got little legs! Say, you're tall. Maybe you'd have better luck.

BoyWithDog_6.speaker: Player
BoyWithDog_6.text: Maybe - let me see what I can do.

BoyWithDog_12.speaker: Albert
BoyWithDog_12.text: Good luck - he's the fastest dog in the world.

BoyWithDog_9.speaker: Player
BoyWithDog_9.text: I've got better things to do than catch dogs.

BoyWithDog_5.speaker: Albert
BoyWithDog_5.text: You'd have no chance catching him anyway, slowpoke!

BoyWithDog_4.speaker: Player
BoyWithDog_4.text: Don't be rude to your dog. He's doing a great job running.

BoyWithDog_8.speaker: Albert
BoyWithDog_8.text: Yeah, that's the problem! Sparky is TOO good at running.

BoyWithDog_11.speaker: Albert
BoyWithDog_11.text: Good boy, Sparky! I'll sneak you some secret bacon at home.

BoyWithDog_13.speaker: Albert
BoyWithDog_13.text: I'm gonna be so late for tea... I hope mam's not angry.

VampireBookClub02_0.speaker: Caerdwyn
VampireBookClub02_0.text: You should join us next time for the Book Brigade! Not sure what we're reading, though.

VampireBookClub02_1.speaker: Caerdwyn
VampireBookClub02_1.text: Tell you what, I really enjoyed our book this month. Dusk's Dark Desires - highly recommend it.

VampireBookClub02_2.speaker: Caerdwyn
VampireBookClub02_2.text: That was nothing like the violence I've read about... It was horrid.

RetiredFists_Elf02_0.speaker: Avourel
RetiredFists_Elf02_0.text: Gods... not seen action like that in an age. Hope I don't have to again.

RetiredFists_Elf02_1.speaker: Avourel
RetiredFists_Elf02_1.text: Aye, well met, citizen! Oh, I mean, fellow citizen, I guess. Sorry - not used to retirement.

RetiredFists_Elf02_2.speaker: Avourel
RetiredFists_Elf02_2.text: Most elves don't oft retire. Guess I'm one of the lucky few.

AD_BookClub_0.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_0.text: Now, I personally loved the book's setting.

AD_BookClub_11.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_11.text: Twisty corridors, flickering candlelight - oh, it's just such compelling reading.

AD_BookClub_1.speaker: Morgan
AD_BookClub_1.text: Nah, the blood and sex were the best bits. Of any book, really.

AD_BookClub_3.speaker: Caerdwyn
AD_BookClub_3.text: No, I'm with Kepli. The novel's sense of intrigue was its finest quality.

AD_BookClub_22.speaker: Morgan
AD_BookClub_22.text: Don't get me wrong - the book intrigued me. In all the right ways.

AD_BookClub_7.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_7.text: So - Book Brigade. What did we think of Dusk's Dark Desires?

AD_BookClub_21.speaker: Caerdwyn
AD_BookClub_21.text: A thrilling read. Gave me goosepimples.

AD_BookClub_14.speaker: Morgan
AD_BookClub_14.text: Goosepimples are right - bits of the book were downright naughty.

AD_BookClub_16.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_16.text: Morgan, please. We're in public, let's keep away from the book's racier parts.

AD_BookClub_8.speaker: Morgan
AD_BookClub_8.text: Racy? More like juicy. A very juicy read.

AD_BookClub_4.speaker: Caerdwyn
AD_BookClub_4.text: Yeah, the book was a lot more... lewd than its prequels.

AD_BookClub_5.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_5.text: Please focus, we're the Book Brigade, not a smut symposium!

AD_BookClub_12.speaker: Caerdwyn
AD_BookClub_12.text: So, Kepli - who was your favourite character in the book?

AD_BookClub_2.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_2.text: I really liked what the author did with Bedford.

AD_BookClub_20.speaker: Caerdwyn
AD_BookClub_20.text: I agree. Who'd have thought a were-cow could be written so beautifully?

AD_BookClub_6.speaker: Morgan
AD_BookClub_6.text: You're fools, obviously Dusk was the story's best character.

AD_BookClub_18.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_18.text: The novel's protagonist is such a basic choice, Morgan.

AD_BookClub_19.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_19.text: Listen, I know what I like - and the book delivered it in spades.

AD_BookClub_15.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_15.text: What did we think of the story's ending?

AD_BookClub_13.speaker: Morgan
AD_BookClub_13.text: The book ended too soon - there was plenty of Dusk left to explore.

AD_BookClub_9.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_9.text: Oh come on, Morgan, it's so much better when the story ends openly.

AD_BookClub_17.speaker: Morgan
AD_BookClub_17.text: No it's not. What's the point of a story without an ending?

AD_BookClub_10.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_10.text: A book's all about the journey, Morgan. Obviously.

AD_BookClub_23.speaker: Kepli
AD_BookClub_23.text: And what were your general feelings on the book?
